en: Successful launch for European Capital of Culture 2016 in Wrocław
On 17 January, European Capital of Culture 2016 officially opened in Wrocław, Poland with an organiser's estimate of 120,000 people in attendance.
Scene from Wrocław launch (Photo: BTW Maziarz / Rajter)
58-Document for general distribution (intended for the general public)
On 17 January, the European Capital of Culture 2016 was officially opened in Wrocław, Poland with an organiser's estimate of 120,000 people in attandence.

Tibor Navracsics, European Commissioner for Education, Culture, Youth and Sport, gave a speech as part of the opening, commending the recent efforts of Rafał Dutkiewicz, Mayor of Wrocław, and his team in promoting inter-cultural dialogue and understanding in the city.

The official opening was followed by four artistic parades, drawing huge crowds, which converged in the main square of Wrocław from different corners of the city. Here, a spectacular show combining music, light and a performance involving hundreds of people rounded off the day.

The opening weekend demonstrated above all the interest and motivation of the people of Wrocław, who participated en masse. The quality and efficiency of the organising team, both the Wrocław 2016 team and the local authorities alike, was evident, as was the artistic invention that went into the the weekend's festivities. A substantial media presence ensured coverage of the launch around Europe.

A particular highlight of the day was an exhibition tracing the 25 years of the European Union Prize for Contemporary Architecture – Mies van der Rohe Award that received 8,000 visitors on its first day.
